summary: States received hundreds of billions in federal COVID-19 relief funds. Selected state budget office staff we spoke with said they experienced some challenges with planning for and using the funds, such as delays and changes to federal guidance. They also noted that: Using pre-existing federal programs to distribute the funds was more efficient for states and the flexibility of new programs allowed them to address...
title: COVID-19 Relief Funds: State Experiences Could Inform Future Federal Relief Funding
